All the vampires are sad, angry and worried about having lost this otherwise very essential part of them, and everyone’s sitting with a feeling of having lost that one thing that makes them who they are.

User summary:

The document includes two page sizes (A4 and A5) which may complicate printing. The game has the same English title in both the English- and Danish-language versions.

201616.name: Brasst Issinn
201616.description:
From the introduction:

Brasst Issinn is an intense, short form scenario about disappointed love, fermented resentment and ice cold air. The scenario switches between storytelling scenes about the boy on the thinner and thinner ice, and scenes in the cabin, in which the players develop the quiet buildup to the inevitable row. The game ends when the row breaks out - and ice breaks under the boy.

User summary:

The game progress is tracked with tokens and a status board, both included as print-and-play components in the document. The tracking board can also be downloaded as a separate one-page PDF document.

201617.name: Black Books: Tomes of the Outer Dark
201617.description:
From publisher blurb:

Black Books: Tomes of the Outer Dark is an OSR investigative horror role-playing game where the player charactersare ordinary people (historians, detectives, scholars, artists etc.) drawn into a dark and horrific version of our world - the world of the Cthulhu Mythos. As the investigators learn more of the true horrors of the world and the irrelevance of humanity, their sanity inevitably withers away. The rules are biased towards playing in the 1920’s although there is no reason these rules can’t be adapted to other time periods. The rules are familiar - they use a D20 for most actions - and the games is class based, with 5 investigator classes - Charmer, Enforcer, Sneak, Scholar and Spiritualist. If you like old school gaming and you like horror, this might well be the game you're looking for!

201618.name: Agents of Mayhem
201618.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

The game is set in a futuristic open world.

201619.name: Entour Travel Game
201619.description:
Entour is a roll and move travel game with an educational objective. The board is a linear track of 38 destinations starting from a Port of Departure and ending in a Port of Arrival. There is no rhyme or reason to the order of the destinations, which are literally all over the map.

One player or non-player acts as the Tour Director, and holds the pack of Destination Cards (which list a variety of information about each destination. There are three piles of Itinerary Cards labelled Day 1, Day 3, and Day 6. Each player starts with $3,430. Each destination has a landing fee, starting at $300 for the first destination, Antigua, and rising to $1,000 by the final one, Tokyo.

Each player rolls two dice and advances that many destinations. First he pays the landing fee to the bank. Second, the Tour Director asks him what he knows about that destination. If the player supplies any of the information on the destination cards, he gets rewards. Third, he may buy the destinations Investment Certificate, which pays dividends each time a player lands there. Finally, he then takes an Itinerary Card, from the Day 1 pile on turn 1, Day 3 on turn 2, Day 6 on turn 3 and rotating from there.

When they reach the Port of Arrival, players must pay $500 and start over. The game ends as soon as one player runs out of money, and the winner is the one with the most money left.

201620.name: Alpha Blue
201620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warning: Alpha Blue contains potentially offensive material in regards to sexual content, adult situations, vulgar language, mature themes, etc.

This book is not only a rules light sci-fi RPG (d6 dice pools similar to both Crimson Dragon Slayer and The Outer Presence), but a campaign setting full of tables and scenario seeds. And what is that setting? Well, Alpha Blue is one of the most notorious space station brothels in the universe.

And what makes this different than similar offerings? Three things! The first is humor. I've made this a fun read with hilarious, gonzo shenanigans around every corner. The second is sex appeal. Plenty of folks won't buy this book. Hell, they won't even read a free PDF if it was shoved in their face. Why? Because some of it is raunchy, disgusting, perverted, and just plain gross. Your welcome, skeezoids! Third, I love old school sci-fi. So much, in fact, that the future is seen through a 1970s and 80s perspective.

Don't forget tables, tables, and more tables! Mutations, alien quirks, funky fashion, just the right retro color palette, what's inside that asteroid, what are the scanners picking up, did you assassinate your victim, how does your therapy-bot help you cope with life among the stars, is the space station's central computer in a favorable mood, sexual fetish, weird space cocktails, etc. A third of this book is fricken random tables!

Also, there's a ridiculous amount of awesome artwork and schematic designs by Glynn Seal. Not only four individual space station maps that can combine into one mega-map but a super cool starship, as well.

Hopefully, you enjoy using and abusing Alpha Blue as much as I enjoyed having sex with... er, I mean, creating her.

201621.name: Christmas on the Moon
201621.description:
Author's blurb:

Players will be challenged on several fronts when they race against time are forced to work together, in a situation where resources are few and good opportunities almost non-existent. There will be a focus on teamwork and individual characters' unique abilities as players' actions and decisions during the scenario will be crucial for the outcome of the game. It will be a battle for survival against a superior enemy...

User summary:

This was an English-only game for Fastaval 2015. The game document was available in two formatting versions - a complete PDF, and two PDFs with the player handouts split into a separate file. The two PDF version has different formatting, fewer graphics, and no page backgrounds to assist in printing.

201622.name: Girls Gone Rogue
201622.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warning: Girls Gone Rogue contains words and pictures of a sexual nature.

If you want to take your space opera, exploration of the stars, or retro sci-fi emulation to a rating of R, NC-17, or even XXX, then consider Girls Gone Rogue your gateway drug of choice.

This is the one and only supplement for Alpha Blue... your sleazy, vintage parody of so many sci-fi movies and TV shows! Girls Gone Rogue has tables for making your alien even more unique, female idiosyncracies (more than likely, you'll be picking up a girl or two at your local space pub), starship combat, what the PCs were up to in-between adventures, and countless others.

It also provides further information on playing mystical knights known as the zedi and star priests known as templars... with a few tips for playing robots, too.

The book also has a detailed multi-session adventure, as well as, several scenario seeds/sketches for your campaign. You don't need Alpha Blue to get a lot of use out of Girls Gone Rogue... but it helps.

Along with the book, there are several high quality maps of starships and a somewhat generic but totally awesome "bar" that's featured in a variety of adventures. If you want these maps in a larger file size (for blowing up and laminating), just let me know.

One last thing, some of the content of Girls Gone Rogue should be considered "adults only". Visually, if goes beyond Alpha Blue. You've been warned...

201624.description:
This Add-on allows owners of the first edition (Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Exotic Predators (2015)) to use the two exclusive Apex Decks included in that edition with the second edition (Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game (2015)) in which they were not included

This Exotic Predator Add-on Expansion cards released in the second Kickstarter includes additional cards and Alphas for the Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus decks.

Quetzalcoatlus is a very specialized predator relying heavily on critical ambushes or swarming the skies with Drones and the Commander. Planning ahead is a requirement for this Apex to stand a chance against bigger predators.

Apex Deck Difficulty : Brutal

Sarcosuchus is a nasty, strictly-ambush predator. Ambushing is an absolute must along with hoarding every bit of food to expand your species. Ambush, hibernate, and grow is the key with this Apex.

Apex Deck Difficulty : Brutal

Note: Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus Apex Decks from Exotic Predators Limited Edition are required in order to play as Quetzalcoatlus or Sarcosuchus species.
boardgameaccessory: Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Exotic Predators
201624.name: Apex Theropod Deck-Building Game: Exotic Predators Add-On – Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus Expansion Cards

201625.name: Children of Dunsain
201625.description:
From the introduction:

Children of Dunsain is inspired by the old (pre-Tolkien wave) fantasy short stories of Lord Dunsany. You could say that it's a bit like Game of Thrones, but weirder. As a game, Children of Dunsain aims to create a situation where the players (and the GM) have power but not much control, both regarding the lives of the player characters in the fiction, and regarding the creation of setting and story in play, at the table. Making an exciting experience out of emergent co-creation is an important goal of the game.

201628.name: In a Galaxy Nearby
201628.description:
From the introduction:

In a Galaxy Nearby is about building stories and acting them out. Basically, it’s fan-fiction on two levels. The players get to re-tell the Star Wars saga just the way they want, and at the same time they tell the stories about their own characters and how those stories fit in with the main events.

There is no predetermined scene flow, except for the start and the end. The scenario is largely driven by what the players decide to do, with some help from the GM to set the stage for the scenes and push the story along, if needed.

201629.description:
The coming of the dark star has long been foretold among the dark prophets of Terrinoth. When it falls, they say, an age of darkness will overtake the world, and its coming shall be heralded by a rain of dark shards that corrupt every stout and honorable soul. This dark and corrupted Terrinoth becomes the focus of your struggle to survive with the Runebound (Third Edition): Fall of the Dark Star – Scenario Pack.

Like other Scenario Packs, Fall of the Dark Star introduces an entirely new scenario to your games of Runebound, offering a substantially different experience with thirty new adventure cards: ten for each of the three archetypes. You may battle a Starborn Specter or travel to the Howling Valley in search of a fallen dark shard, but no matter where you go a new deck of story cards continues to raise the stakes as you search for the dark shards that fall from the heavens. Finally, you'll find an entirely new hero, Zyla, a being from the Aenlong realm whose otherworldly powers have led her to become a hero of Terrinoth.
201629.name: Runebound (Third Edition): Fall of the Dark Star – Scenario Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 30 - Cry Havoc

201630.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the wilds of Terrinoth, strange beasts have begun to gather. Innocent townsfolk hurry home at night, barring their doors behind them, as bloodthirsty, savage creatures venture farther and farther from their lairs in search of their next meal. The realm has called upon its greatest heroes to venture into the hills and mountains to confront this threat. Only the most stalwart will return with Runebound (Third Edition): The Mountains Rise – Adventure Pack!

Like other Adventure Packs, The Mountains Rise offers new cards that can be incorporated into any existing scenario to dramatically change the flavor and feel. Fifteen new adventure cards (five per deck) introduce new enemies, events, and quests while twenty new asset cards and ten new skill cards give you dozens of new ways to customize your hero. Many of these new assets come with new combat tokens, some of which introduce new combat symbols to the game — ensuring that your Runebound battles will never be the same. Finally, you’ll gain an entirely new hero: Nanok of the Blade, a warrior who eschews armor in favor of the pure thrill of battle.
201630.name: Runebound (Third Edition): The Mountains Rise – Adventure Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 30 - Cry Havoc

201631.name: Feats
201631.description:
Publisher blurb:

Based on feedback from our surveys and a number of requests on Twitter, this month’s Unearthed Arcana introduces new feats for fifth edition D&D.

In addition to those new feats, this installment also talks about feat design and the place of feats in the game. Using design examples, we highlight what we want new feats to accomplish—and what they need to avoid, so as to not slow things down or interfere with the DM’s ability to run the game.

201632.name: Fly-In
201632.description:
The brightly colored board makes this game look simple, but it is not. There are one red and one white dice, and a single 47-space track spiralling counter-clockwise and inward from the Start. The track includes 10 spaces where players draw Situation Cards that provide benefits or penalties. But the key to the game are the 21 spaces labelled Log Book and numbered 1, 2 or 3.

When landing on a Log Book space, the player rolls the dice twice more. The first red-white combination determines the section of the Log Book to consult (e.g. a 5 red, 2 white = section 52). A second roll, adding the two dice, gives the question number to be asked (e.g. a red 4 and white 3 = question # 7)

These are not simple questions. The easier ones are True/False or multiple choice, but some ask for detailed knowledge of flying rules (e.g. "What is wrong with a pilot flying a heading of 200 degrees at an altitude of 3,500 feet?", aeronautics ("Vfc/Mfc means ?") and even history ("What date did the airforce take delivery of the first P47D?").

To win, the player must make it to the second-last square and answer two questions correctly, then roll doubles and answer two final questions. The rules say that Fly-In "can be a learning tool to help the aspiring pilot be more aware of the world of flying".

201633.name: Quantum Black Bonus Disk
201633.description:
Bonus DVD sent out to Kickstarter backers. Contains the following PDFs:


Bonus Adventure - The Hungry Dark
Casting Ritual Magic Quick Reference
Character Creation Quick Reference
Introductory Scene - The Starlite Diner
Quantum Black Character Sheet Standard Version
Quantum Black Character Sheet Two Page Version
Quantum Black Core Book
Sample Character - Sonja Rostovic - Revised
Sanity and Resilience Quick Reference

201634.name: The Cruellest Mistress of All
201634.description:
From the publisher blurb:

The Cruellest Mistress of All is an adventure module for 5E (5th edition fantasy roleplaying game). For 4th level PCs. It is the sequel to The Last Prayer of the Dying.

This is part 2 of a much larger campaign set in the Duchy of Keranow. The Duchy itself is inspired by myths of the British Isles, The Norse Lands and France. It seeks to lightly draw in elements from Historic Cornish, Arthurian, Celt and Viking legends.

This module was kickstarted in spring of 2016.

It contains:

A small town in the wilderness frontier lands. the town is attacked at the start of the module by Orc-Reavers and the PCs can save it in a number of different ways
Three dungeons. A) A six level keep of about 36 areas, that belonged to a now dead knight. B) The Death Pits of the Gorathi, a 16 area dungeon of classic monsters, used as a testing ground by the Orc Reavers. C) A small lair of the main antagonist in the adventure.
A brief gazetteer of the orc-reavers
10 wilderness encounters to get a feel for the setting.
A number of random tables to add flavour to the town and wilderness.
The PCs should start at 4th level and be 7th by the end of this adventure.
The Adventure is furthered enhanced by the 58 item Cruellest Mistress Digital File Pack also available on OBS.
The sequel to this adventure, Lament For The Elf Princess, will be available via Kickstarter very soon.

201635.name: Tales from the Five Fallen Empires
rpg: Tales from the Five Fallen Empires
201635.description:
User summary:

The document presents five "nano scenes" comprising an anthology of five thematically similar scenarios. The game was considered to be a thematic sequel of In The Deep Dark Strange Forest, published for Fastaval 2014.

The five scenarios are:
- The Child Alone in Total Darkness
- Tears for Bethmoora
- The Bunker
- The Ruined City in the Jungle
- Split Utopia

In Danish:
- Barnet der vågner alene
- Tårer for Bethmoora
- Bunkeren
- Ruinbyen i junglen
- Split Utopia

201636.name: The Game of Planting
201636.description:
This early American card game is a festival of puns for gardeners. It consists of an 8-page rule booklet and 72 small (3.25" x 1") yellow cards, each of which has a number, a phrase "Plant ....." and the question: "What will come up?"

The rules say it is best played by "a large and mixed company", with one person chosen as Keeper of the Pool, or more precisely holder of the answer book. The cards are distributed equally among the players along with an equal number of tokens. Players take turns asking the player to their left the question on one of their cards, the answer to which is always some kind of plant or flower. The Keeper of the Pool judges the answer against the book and if the answer is wrong, the responder pays the asker one of his tokens.

Some examples from the book:
Plant a shepherd. What will come up? Phlox.
Plant a river. What will come up? A Currant.
Plant a man who won't pay his debts. What will come up? Willow.

There is one exceptional rule. "7. By vote of a majority of the players, rewards shall be paid from the pool for unusual brilliancy, and fines imposed for ludicrously erroneous answers. For example, when this game was first played, a young lady drawled out, in answer to the question 'Plant a menagerie. What will come up?' the single word 'Grapes'. Upon being made to realize that she intended to suggest the idea of 'Gray apes', the Keeper of the Pool voluntarily paid to her the sum of ten counters." Yes, that entire passage is in the rule booklet.

201637.name: Hourglass of Life
201637.description:
There is a girl in a hospital with only seven days to live. Can you save her?

Hourglass of Life is a roll-and-move game cooperative game with a traitor, and variable board consisting of cards that start face down. As players land on cards, they pick up the card then put a card from their hand in its place, optionally activating the card placed. Every time the turn goes back around to the start player, the days remaining ticks down.

For the "good" players to win, one of them needs to make it to the end of the track before time runs out — but the traitor wins if he makes it to the end first, or if time runs out.

201638.name: RAF Lion
201638.description:
User Summary

Based on the Lion part of the board game. France has fallen. England stands alone against the might of a triumphant Germany, defended only by the Spitfire and Hurricane squadrons of the Royal Air Force. Hitler orders his mighty Luftwaffe to destroy the RAF in preparation for Operation Sealion—the invasion of England. German fighters and bombers fill the English skies and the RAF responds. Scenarios range from one raid day, taking an hour to complete, to the full campaign, playable in 12 hours.

201639.name: ABXY
201639.description:
ABXY is a competitive 2-player simultaneous action selection game. Players use hand-picked teams of extraordinary creatures to battle until one player has no one left.

Learn the game in 3 minutes, play a match in 5-15 minutes.

Players begin a standard match with a team of creature cards and 4 button cards representing A, B, X, and Y actions. A single creature card is the active combatant for each player while all others sit on the side awaiting use.

All creatures in the game possess types, a weight, a passive ability, and a special action tied to one of the four button cards.

Each round, players secretly and simultaneously select a first and second action card. Players reveal and resolve their first action and then reveal and resolve their second. When directly contested actions occur, the lighter weight creature acts first.

By default, the A action deals damage, the B action prevents damage and then deals damage back to the attacker, the X action switches out a player's active combatant for a different one, and the Y action prevents future blocking or takes control of an opponent's attempt to switch. A creature's special action entirely replaces the default effect of one action button.

Types have no innate effect on gameplay (so players don't need to remember special rules based on types) but are sometimes referenced in passive abilities or special actions.

The most important effect in the game is damage. Rather than dealing with health totals, chits, dials, or dice, a creature is either damaged or it isn't. When a creature becomes damaged, it is flipped over to its damaged side. If a creature that is already damaged becomes damaged again, it is defeated.

When a player's last creature has been defeated, so has that player.

201640.name: Run Them Again
201640.description:
From the introduction:

You ran the numbers when you came out of hypersleep. You have a 19.5% chance of survival. To get even that much you must be back in your can in less than three hours and thirty-one minutes. There are things you can do increase the odds, but they offer no guarantees. In fact, attempting them may kill you faster.

User summary:

An English-only game for Fastaval 2014.

201641.name: I Say a Little Prayer
201641.description:
From the introduction:

I Say a Little Prayer is set in a Nordic capital in the 1980s. The game master decides which city this particular run will be set in. At that time Copenhagen, Oslo and Stockholm all had similar, rather small gay scenes with just a handful of bars and other venues that were the gay meeting spots in the city. So the feel of the game should be quite similar no matter which city you choose. Ask the players if they are from or know well one of these cities to determine which one it will be the best one to use. Also ask the players which language they would like to play the game in if this hasn’t been determined before you gather with the players. In the scenario there are some specified lines that kicks off some of the scenes. Just translate those to a similar line in the language you are playing in if not playing in English.

User summary:

This was an English-only game for Fastaval 2014.

201642.name: Super Duper Party Pooper
201642.description:
Have you ever wanted to poop on party goers but were too socially awkward to just go for it? Well, Super Duper Party Pooper is about to change all that.

Source: The Developer Website.

201643.name: Heart&Slash
201643.description:
Fight as Heart, an innocent robot fighting to escape the grip of mindless machines in a future where humans are no more. A fast-paced 3D brawler with roguelike elements set in a colorful yet desolated world.

Source: The Developer Website.

201644.name: TurnOn
201644.description:
"TurnOn" tells the spellbinding tale of a brave alien creature and its striking journey through blackout world, in an incredibly colorful and detailed platformer without platforms.

Source: The Developer Website.

201645.name: Score Rush
201645.description:
t is the world's first widescreen bullet-hell shmup, with multidirectional dual-stick controls.

Source: The Developer Website.

201646.name: One Piece: Burning Blood
201646.description:
The game features a cel-shaded artstyle, similar to the One Piece anime. The game features an “advanced battle system”, which allows players to perform stronger attacks and block normal attacks from enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One_Piece%3A_Burning_Blood One Piece: Burning Blood]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

201647.name: Daydreamer
201647.description:
Daydreamer is a classic platformer focused around Boss fights, blowing up Aliens and Robots, and using speed and abilities to evade attacks as you traverse mind-blowing alien landscapes.

Source: The Developer Website.

201648.name: Apocalypse: Party's Over
201648.description:
HIT enemies in the face with your own JOHNSON and make the apocalypse happen! Play with your friend and help JESUS to achieve his goal: the end of the world!

Source: The Game Website.

201649.name: KNIGHTS
201649.description:
KNIGHTS is a minimalistic puzzle game based on a single chess piece, the titular knight. A simple enough to pick up and relaxing experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

201650.name: Waltz of the Wizard
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Interaction Design of the Year Nominee
201650.description:
Waltz of the Wizard is a virtual reality experience that lets you feel what it’s like to have magical powers. Combine arcane ingredients into a boiling cauldron with the help of an ancient spirit trapped in a human skull. Unleash creative or destructive wizardry upon a fully interactive virtual world.

Source: The Developer Website.

201651.name: Kraken
201651.description:
User summary:

Only one copy of this adventure module was printed and professionally bound. It was run and auctioned off at GaryCon III.

201652.name: Demetrios - The BIG Cynical Adventure
201652.description:
Demetrios is a full-length adventure game packed with cynical humor. 8 to 12 hours of fun!

Source: The Game Website.

201653.name: Tower 3D
201653.description:
Tower!3D is the successor to the best-selling Tower! 2011 airport tower simulator. Using an intuitive command interface, users of all levels can enjoy the Tower!3D experience. Tower!3D brings the whole environment to life in full 3D with realistic foliage, real time weather changes and volumetric lighting.

Source: The Game Website.

201654.name: Torgar's Quest
201654.description:
Travel into the Deepgold Mine to hunt for shards of the Mastery Crystal in this roguelike dungeon crawl, following the adventures of Torgar Splitbeard.

Source: The Game Website.

201655.name: GEO Master
201655.description:
GEO Master is a 3D geography game. This game has different learning modes. You have the opportunity to explore the globe, you can test your knowledge and then compare your score obtained during timed games on the whole planet or on the continent of your choice !

Source: The Game Website.

201656.name: Rescue Lucy
201656.description:
Rescue Lucy, is a game with mysterious atmosphere which immerses you in this amazing adventure.

Source: The Publisher Website.

201657.name: Solitairica
201657.description:
Solitairica takes RPG combat and challenging roguelike progression to a fresh new place—the world of solitaire! Using a variety of magical items and powerful spells, battle your way through a horde of ever-changing enemies and defeat the horrible Emperor Stuck.

Source: The Developer Website.

201658.name: The Dope Game
201658.description:
To escape the city of Starkham and start your new life, you get your friend Preston to set up a meeting with the local loanshark, Sweaty Mike. After foolishly borrowing $2,000 to start your fledging drug dealing career, you embark on a timed mission to sell as many drugs as possible throughout the city.

Source: The Game Website.

201659.name: Tumbleweed Express
201659.description:
Trains with guns on them in the Wild West! Shoot, upgrade, customize, and mount up to defeat brutal outlaws and ruthless businessmen! Tumbleweed Express is a tower, or travel, defense game set in the American West.

Source: The Developer Website.

201660.name: The Battle for Sector 219
201660.description:
The Battle for Sector 219 is an abstract strategy card game where two players field a sci-fi army battling a rival race for control of a world's capital city. The game is easy to learn and quick to play but has a depth of strategy usually found only in games that takes much longer to play.

Source: The Game Website.

201661.name: The NADI Project
201661.description:
The NADI Project it is a first person graphic adventure, in which you will face various obstacles to escape from your destiny.

Source: The Developer Website.

201662.name: Wander No More
201662.description:
Wander No More is a Kinetic Novel (a visual novel without any choices) which centers around the life of Kouichirou Nabatame, a renowned samurai, and Chiyo, a young village girl.

Source: The Publisher Website.

201663.name: Magma Tsunami
201663.description:
Magma Tsunami is a frenzied arcade platformer game.

Source: The Developer Website.

201664.name: Danish Deathworks
201664.description:
Propaganda Pamphlet adventure for Weird War Two dual statted for D20 levels 3rd-4th.

A military strike on a factory. A non-supernatural adventure with weird tech. Deep in the Bavarian mountains, Nazi scientists have developed a top-secret serum designed to help them in their quest to create a pure Aryan race. Code-named Uberunter, the serum is lethal to all but those whose genetic structure is suitably Aryan. Is this serum designed only for an SS rite of passage, or do the Nazis have darker designs for Uberunter? The Allies need a sample of this deadly drug. The spy network on the continent has learned that doses of Uberunter have been sent to a Danish syringe manufacturer in Denmark named Tor Anders. This represents the Allies' best chance for obtaining a sample. All that is now needed are volunteers to go behind enemy lines and find a way to get it. Something is rotten in Denmark and it isn't just fish.

Designed for the Weird War Two: Crusade for Europe RPG system but also contains conversions for the d20 SRD system. They can also be used for any WWII-themed game system. Each is 16-page pamphlet containing everything a GM needs to run a single-session adventure. They also include a variety of new equipment, monsters, and technology for the WW2:CFE game system.

201665.name: Something Crawls to the Surface
201665.description:
Propaganda Pamphlet adventure for Weird War Two dual statted for D20 levels 5-6.

A covert mission in the Ukraine goes awry . Horror with supernatural elements. Three years ago, a group of Ukrainian soldiers laid their guns down before invading SS troops bent on the defeat of the Soviet Union. The Ukrainians expected to be treated with dignity and to spend the war working hard labor for the Third Reich. Annoyed by the delay, Obersturmfuhrer Stauffen ordered the prisoners gunned down. Their bodies were thrown into a lake. Now the Ukrainians have two enemies. Partisan groups, like the OUN, fight the German occupiers. Stalin and his Red Army, while pushing back the Germans, are not welcome to the Ukraine. The heroes have been assigned to parachute into this chaos and meet with these partisans. The drop zone is near the lake where a memorial stands for the fallen...

Designed for the Weird War Two: Crusade for Europe RPG system but also contains conversions for the d20 SRD system. They can also be used for any WWII-themed game system. Each is 16-page pamphlet containing everything a GM needs to run a single-session adventure. They also include a variety of new equipment, monsters, and technology for the WW2:CFE game system.

201666.name: A Coming Storm
201666.description:
Propaganda Pamphlet adventure for Weird War Two dual statted for D20 levels 5-6.

A military strike to recapture an Allied base against supernatural opponents. Storm clouds were gathering off the banks of the windswept Shetland Islands. White tipped waves crashed about the sleek dragon-headed ship carrying Hrothgar Runefist and his band. The shifting winds caused the canvas sails to flap like the wings of carrion birds over a battlefield. Hrothgar grasped at an empty scabbard and growled, cursing the Alf who had stolen his rune sword. On the island, a young fisherman's attention is drawn by a bluish glow upon the stormy sea. He rubs his eyes with disbelief as the dragon ship glides out of the fog and into the nearby harbor. The soldiers at the harbor are caught by surprise as ancient warriors surrounded by a blue nimbus of light quickly overtake their positions. Wolf-headed men leap off the dragon ship and begin shooting with MP-40's. The young fisherman starts the motor of his small boat and turns it around. He decides to head for the base at Scapa Flow. A Nazi flag flaps mockingly from the mast of the dragon ship as if it were waving him away....History is repeating itself in this new adventure!

Designed for the Weird War Two: Crusade for Europe RPG system but also contains conversions for the d20 SRD system. They can also be used for any WWII-themed game system. Each is 16-page pamphlet containing everything a GM needs to run a single-session adventure. They also include a variety of new equipment, monsters, and technology for the WW2:CFE game system.

201667.name: Nazi Zombies of World War One
rpg: Nazi Zombies of World War One
201667.description:
From the introduction:

Nazi Zombies of World War One is an action/horror storytelling game set in the trenches of the Western Front during World War One, in 1917. After the warmup and a prologue scene there are four main scenes and three interludes, and then an epilogue. In the main scenes the players tell about the war and their characters in it, and later about the menacing Nazi zombies. Every time a player has had their turn and told a bit, they have to roll a four-sided die. If they roll a one they become "threatened." If they roll a one while threatened, their character dies. The first main scene ends after one has fallen, the rest after two have kicked the bucket. The intent is to build up tension and at the same time tell a grim tale. If your character dies, you must instead speak for the war and the Nazi zombies. You don't play an individual Nazi zombie. In the interlude, players with surviving characters play more traditional in-character roleplay. This builds up the characters as people that we care about, so there's something to lose when the bullets are flying and the dice are rolling.

201668.description:
Cosmic Balance is a hybrid board/card game of battling gods, angels, and demons for 2-5 players. It takes under an hour to play. Your cards become the fighting units that conquer and control territories. You get Victory Points from each territory you control at the end of your turn plus bonus points from Angel and Demon cards. The player with the most Victory Points when the supply runs out wins!

The game features a large scale in the center of the board, with a discard tray on each end representing Heaven and Hell. Since you're a god you decide whether to send defeated cards to the Heaven discard tray or the Hell discard tray. The scale tracks how many defeated enemies have been sent to Heaven or Hell. Tip the scales and open the gates of Hell or Heaven. When the gates of Heaven are open, you can more easily summon angels from The Beyond to fight for you. The same is true for Hell and demons.

Before playing, each player selects two god powers and factions. God powers are special abilities that break the rules and factions are the cards that make up each player's deck, such as vampires, knights, wolves, merchants, farmers, giants, shepherds, or thieves.
201668.name: Cosmic Balance
boardgamepodcastepisode: Interview Special #17: Alexandra 'Alex' Tinsman (GigaDragon - Cosmic Balance)

201669.description:
New Job: Preserve the temporal continuity of an alternate universe.

New Boss: Step aside Bob. Oracle is in charge of this team.

New Mission: Remove every corrupt member of the Gotham City Police Department.

This is an adaptation of the Batman: Year One story.
However, no previous knowledge of Batman is needed to play, complete, or enjoy this game.
There are some easter eggs for those that have read the source material.
201669.name: Batman: Year One (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)

201670.name: The Prophet
201670.description:
In a time of crisis, will you choose to remain calm or fall into the panic? This is a game about a doomsday prophecy. Players’ goal is to become the Prophet and brainwash everyone into believing that the world is ending. In this mind game, Everyone starts out with the same amount of sanity points. Once your sanity points are gone, you fall into a state of madness. The player who plays the role of the Prophet will spread his prophecy(madness), and convert every other player into the state of madness, thus becoming his follower. Once he turns everyone into his follower, he wins.

The rest of the players need to not only keep themselves from losing their sanity but at the same time, expose the Prophet’s lies. The player who destroys the Prophet’s last bit of sanity will become the next the Prophet. There is no trust in this game, as anyone who fights on your side might be your enemy next round; because the only way to win the game is to become the Prophet and eliminate the nonbelievers yourself.

Our game features a handful of controversial historical figures that had made the significant impact through the course of the world history, whether it is good or bad. Players will be able to play the role of a historical character of their choice, use their unique ability to either fight against the Prophet or be the Prophet themselves.

Now stay sane, and spread the madness.

201672.name: I Delitti del Corvo
201672.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Deep in Texas, the city of Mercy is turned upside down by the discovery of two corpses of the wealthiest men in the city. There are no signs of struggle and no wounds on their bodies; only their face, distorted with terror, recounts the horror of their last moments.

You will be hired to solve the mystery, while the shadowy figure of an aberrant anthropomorphic crow out of hell is haunting the city.

201673.name: Ninja All-Stars: Yagyu Jubei
201673.description: Yagyu Jubei had heard tales of the Moonlight Tournament for years before finally daring the passage to Kagejima to experience the tournament for himself. He has informed the Sun Court that he will not be returning soon; there is simply too much to see, and Jubei has sworn to discover all he can.

201674.name: Boer'n Bluf
201674.description:
Boer'n Bluf is a stunning tricky game for 2 to 10 players where it's all about trickery and deceit. Whose bluffing is best and who can outsmart the other players. But watch out! when someone caught you bluffing, you can start all over again. Try to get rid of your handcards as soon as possible. Be smart and challenge your opponents!

In the game you try to get rid of all the cards in your hand by laying them down on a pile. the first player starts with the Dog card with the golden bone. After that the second player puts his 2 on the pile and the next player his 3's. If you don't have the card that needs to be put down, you "bluff". If someone catches you, you take to whole pile of cards. The first one with no cards in his hand wins.

201675.name: Ninja All-Stars: Benkei
201675.description: Devotion to duty is a hallmark of many on Kagejima. For Benkei, devotion to duty is a defining characteristic. While his martial skill serves him well, it is his utter devotion to the Moon Throne that imparts his famous resilience and fearlessness. They say that the gods could not move Benkei when he takes a stand in the Princess’s name.

201676.name: Ninja All-Stars: Momotaro
201676.description: The life of Momotaro is as strange as Kagejima. He was found as an infant, floating down the river in a giant peach, by an elderly farmer. Growing up on stories of predation by the Ijin lcan and their oni allies, he turned his interest and his tetsubo toward confronting that threat. His legend, strength, and resolve grow with every mission.

201677.name: Heaven Island Life
201677.description:
User Summary

A short game where you explore an island in VR. You need an HTC Vive to play.

201678.name: Ninja All-Stars: Ryu
201678.description: As a young boy, Ryu showed a talent in alchemy and was able to apprentice in this profession with his father. One fateful trip, however, saw them fall victim to a howling group of bandits. He survived, and wandering monks found him. As he grew in their monastery, Ryu soon became a strong and focused fighter with an understandable hatred for those who preyed on the weak.

201679.name: Ninja All-Stars: Mizuchi
201679.description: The Ika are more than just fishermen and traders. They are charged by the Princess herself with watching and protecting Kagejima's coasts. Serious in demeanor, strategically clever, and ruthless in battle, Mizuchi's ship, the Honor of Ishika, and a hail of fire arrows are often the last things would-be invaders ever see.

201680.name: Behind Football
201680.description:
Behind Football is a board game for 2-4 players over 9 years old.

It's a game designed for the family, football players and anyone who loves board games.
The game covers everything behind the scenes, i.e. the business of buying a club, hiring training staff, building a stadium and investing in club shares.

The ref's card and 3rd half card keep the atmosphere continuously tense, with lively comments and orders to be carried out.

On your way to success you’ll meet sponsors and the fan club. You will go through nerve-wracking matches and once in a while, will have to suffer the indignity of a touchline ban.

You will be taken through the entire emotional spectrum with Behind Football.

Who supports the best club?
How will MY club perform?
And “if only they’d bought him” or “fire the manager!” are familiar comments from any professional sofa manager.
The passion and belief that anyone can run a football club from the sofa has made a whole range of computer-based football manager games highly popular.
These two concepts are now finally brought together in the Christmas present of the year: “Behind Football”!

The game can be played by 2-4 “clubs”. The winner will be the club which gets the most from its initial investment in the form of the best manager, the best team and the biggest stadium!

PLAYING THE GAME

Players place their pieces on the beginning square (1)
players roll a dice or dices and move his piece as per the numbers indicated on the dice, clockwise.
when landing on a field, events are triggered and followed.




THE FLOW AND AIMS OF THE GAME IS TO

control one or more clubs by buying, renting or selling them.
develop stadiums.
build team spirit.
buy and sell shares in the club to make a profit.
draw a "3rd half" card, with comments or good/bad instructions to be followed.
draw "Rank" cards, allowing the manager/trainer to rise or fall in ranking.
draw a "Referee" card with comments from the referee.
lead the club through exiting matches.
experience pressure from the fans or the press.
become manager of the month.
serve bans.
participate in meetings with sponsors.
complete your mission
LET THE MONEY MACHINE FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL AND DREAMS.

201681.name: LightBearers RPG: Luceat Lux Vestra! - Core Book
201681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lucheat Lux Vestra is a role-playing game, or RPG. This is a type of game where players take on the role of various heroes that go on thrilling adventures. Lucheat Lux Vestra is different from most other role-playing games in the sense that there are no fantastical elements in the game. Instead, it presents a setting that is rooted in one of the darker chapters of Christian history.

However, Lucheat Lux Vestra is also a great tool for examining your morals and beliefs. As heroes in extraordinary circumstances, the Light Bearers are forced to make difficult choices in the name of their faith. This gives the players insight as to how they would feel if they were to be put into similar (though hopefully less high-stakes!) situations in real life, and gives the group something to reflect upon and discuss in the context of Scripture after the session is over.

Unlike board games, Lucheat Lux Vestra does not have a special board or other components. All you need are a copy of this book, some pencils, two decks of playing cards (preferably with different colored backs) and some friends!

Once you’ve got this sorted out, one of you takes the role of the Game Master, or GM. This role is special as they act as the referee and the storyteller in the game. The GM is responsible for narrating the situations, acting out the lines of the other characters and adjudicating the rules. The rest of the players, on the other hand will be making the Light Bearers that work in secret in the Roman Empire to bring His word to those in need.

201682.name: LightBearers RPG: Luceat Lux Vestra! - GM Guide
201682.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome again to Luceat Lux Vestra!
As a Game Master you have a special responsibility in the game. Lux is a game that is both fun and with opportunities to learn from the trials and tribulations of characters from that time period.

As a Game Master, your responsibilities are:
To be the world they play in
To keep the action going
To challenge the characters
To talk it over at the end

Be The World They Play In
As a GM, you’re responsible for painting the image of the situation they’re in. Try to be descriptive and engage all five senses. If the players are trying a daring escape through secret tunnels under the streets of Rome, tell them of the smell of damp soil all around them, and the heat of their torches as they make their way. This helps bring the world to life and helps them immerse themselves into the situation.

Speaking of immersion, don’t be afraid to act out when playing the role of the various Non-Player Characters that the players will be interacting with. You don’t have to go overboard, but even just shifts in body language and word choice go a long way.

Keep The Action Going
Given Light Bringer’s missions, the game should always be moving forward, and the Light Bringers should always be encouraged to make a decision or take a course of action. Sometimes this can be achieved by establishing a deadline, for example, “Antonius will be executed by dawn. We must rescue him tonight!” In other instances it might serve to introduce a more direct threat, like having their location discovered by a group of soldiers. Likewise, perhaps appealing to their Virtues will be best, as a Light Bringer with Justice as their Virtue would be spurred to action by seeing an innocent being beaten up by thugs.

201683.name: Jungle Fun
201683.description:
A combination memory and race game. Make sure you find the path through the jungle the fastest.

The 36 tiles are randomly placer face down on the board, and the 4 playing pieces are placed in each their own corner. Players take turns trying to find pairs. If no pair is found the tiles are turned back face down, otherwise the tiles are removed and a path through the jungle is formed. After each turn a player may move his playing piece as far as possible through the cleared paths. First to reach to opposite corner wins the game.

There is also an advanced game where snakes on the tiles can be place to block opponents from moving.

201684.name: Baantjer: Plaats Delict
201684.description:
This game is based on the Dutch TV series "Baantjer".

From the publisher:
There have been a number of killings in the city and you are put on the case as a detective. The case consists of a suspect, a motive, a weapon, a corpse and a trace. Gather evidence at the scene as quick as possible, and trace the fingerprints of the suspect. Subject your opponents with some hard cross-examination and try to discover important information. Write down your findings with precision and finish the crime.

If you succeed as the best crime detective, you can call yourself "baantjer".

Both players play the role of a detective and a murder. The murder that everyone did consists of five hand cards. Those five cards are a suspect, motive, weapon, corpse and a trace. Every player tries to find out which cards the other players have in their hands. In a players turn, a player is allowed to ask a question to another player that can only be answered with "yes" or "no". If answered with "yes" you are allowed to ask another question, if answered with "no" the turn moves on to the next player.
Asking questions is done with the cards laying face-up on the table with all the case items in a pattern. Every player writes down what he thinks is helpful for his investigation and tries to score points with the right questions.

The game ends when there is only one player left with cards in his hands and a murder that has not bin solved.

201685.description:
An educational boardgame about dinosaurs, made with the consultation of Cristiano Dal Sasso, a well-know italian paleontologist.

The game takes place in two phases: the hatching eggs and the battle of the dinosaurs
During the phase one you spin the wheel to get the cards of that particular type (i.e. quadrupedal, bipedal, carnivorous, herbivorous, etc.). At the end every player take the corresponding cards forming its own deck.
During the phase two you play the dinosaur cards to make them fight comparing the values written on the cards. The last player with a living dinosaur wins the game.
201685.name: DINUOVO

201686.name: Grim Legends 3: The Dark City
201686.description:
HUNT MONSTERS IN THE HAND PAINTED GOTHIC CITY!
Sylvia, the acolyte of the mysterious monster hunting Order, loses her memory. One year later, the Incarceri Stone – a powerful artifact that binds Koshmaar, a horrifying creature from another world – is stolen!

Source: The Developer Website.

201687.name: A Game of Changes
201687.description:
A 3d puzzle platformer that takes you along a journey of wisdom, through the 64 unique worlds that draw inspiration and teachings from the I Ching [Book of Changes], one of the oldest oracles in human history.

Source: The Game Website.

201688.name: Swift
201688.description:
User Summary

Swift is a 2D online multiplayer platformer with the one-hit combat system.

201689.name: Ara Fell
201689.description:
A 16-bit era, Japanese-style roleplaying game set in a magical world floating above the clouds.

Source: The Developer Website.

201690.name: Smoots World Cup Tennis
201690.description:
Smoots World Cup Tennis is an Arcade Tennis game with plenty of possibilities.

Source: The Developer Website.

201691.name: UnderWater Adventure
201691.description:
"UnderWater Adventure" is a 3d action game, with a little part of puzzle.

Source: The Developer Website.

201692.name: Voennaya Taina
201692.description:
User Summary

Voennaya Taina ("The Military Secret") is a Soviet-era game for children aged 7-9 that is pure propaganda. It combines a snakes-and-ladders type track with a story in the rule book that plays out through the illustrations along the track.

It has its roots in a Russian fairy-tale, and shows strapping young lad starting life placidly farming with his father, seeing his father go off to war on horseback and come back wounded, and then following in his footsteps.

He goes off to war, has his comrades in the lines betrayed to the fascists, survives capture and prison and eventually triumphs over both the fascist trio and the cigar-smoking capitalist giving orders behind the scenes.

201693.name: Rexodus: A VR Story Experience
201693.description:
Rexodus: A VR Story Experience is based on the Dark Horse Graphic Novel Rexodus. This is a VR narrative experience set in a universe where dinosaurs didn't go extinct, they left Earth. Those dinosaurs, utilizing their own advanced technology, are traversing the galaxy.

Source: The Game Website.

201694.name: The Concourse
201694.description:
Welcome to The Concourse, a highly competitive racing game that forces players to literally think on their feet. Angus hates Aliens is all about reaction and tactical choices against a plethora of different enemies. Every enemy and every situation requires Angus to think about specific approaches making this game more tactical than your usual shooter.

Created by two brothers, Coffee Pot Terrarium is a turn-based puzzle game of tile manipulation. Raise new pathways to traverse the map, drop tiles to eliminate the enemy. Stop and smell the cherry blossoms.

Being originally designed and developed for the Sega Mega Drive / Genesis, Sacred Line Genesis Remix is an alternate version of the brand new 16-bit horror game. A surreal, twisted kinetic novel tribute to obscure visual novel / adventure games of 90s.

201700.name: Nazotoki Maze-Kara no Dasshutsu

Hashtag Dungeon is a dungeon crawler with roguelike elements that uses Twitter as its method of dungeon generation! Create dungeons yourself using our built-in dungeon editor and tweet your levels to the world, or venture through levels created by other players.

Color Symphony 2 is a puzzle action platformer that utilizes the ambiguity of color. Try to eliminate obstacles or find new paths by using color!

Source: The Developer Website.

201703.name: Soul Axiom
201703.description:
From the studio that brought you Master Reboot comes a first-person story-driven adventure puzzle game, set in the beautiful, haunting cyber-world of Elysia. Collect unique hand powers, discover multiple endings and choose your own destiny as you unravel the mystery of your digital afterlife.

Source: The Developer Website.

201704.name: Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book
201704.description:
The game features a completely reformed world view from earlier titles within the series, in addition to a new alchemy-centric system. Sophie is able to obtain ideas for recipes from activities such as harvesting, exploring, battling, or from events, and these ideas are used as a basis of improving her knowledge of alchemy. 201705.name: Olympia Rising
201705.description:
User Summary

Olympia Rising is a 2-D action platformer starring Iola - a young warrior who has been cast into the Underworld after meeting an untimely end.

201706.name: Sol Trader
201706.description:
Lean on your network of in-game friends and family to trade, mine and explore in this genre-busting space simulation.

Source: The Game Website.

201707.description:
From the designer:

Dungeon Dealer generates random maps with enemies, traps, and obstacles. Draw a card, roll a 20 sided die to see which position the new map section goes, and see if you've been surprised by the enemy. For both free drawing and 3D tiles, every card is different. There are literally billions of ways to lay out a map using these unique cards. Both decks can be combined to create massive dungeons.

For solitary, cooperative, and competitive play, Dungeon Dealer is a flexible game with a number of rules:

Solitary gameplay

a. Initially pulling a starting map card from the deck
b. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the card
c. placing character within that drawn grid map
d. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 inch square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
e. drawing a new card once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
f. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
g. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
h. discarding that used card
i. reacting to the random placement of each asset on the card like enemies, obstacles, and traps
j. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
k. ending game when all cards are drawn or all players perish.

Cooperative gameplay

a. Initially pulling a starting map card from the deck
b. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the card
c. placing character or characters within that draw grid map
d. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 inch square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
e. drawing a new card once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
f. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
g. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
h. discarding that used card
i. reacting to the random placement of each asset on the card like enemies, obstacles, and traps
j. alternating these turns within a group of players until every player has had a turn
k. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
l. ending game when all cards are drawn or all players perish.

Competitive gameplay for 2-10 players

a. dealing out three cards to each player or team of players which they keep secret, no player or team of players can have more than three cards at a time
b. starting on opposite ends of a blank grid map that is either a dry erase board or paper, or on a tabletop for three dimensional tile placement
c. progressing from 1 inch square to 1 in square within the perimeters of the tabletop roleplaying experience
d. drawing a card from the player’s hand once the player is on an unexplored/open edge of the map
e. rolling a 20 sided die to determine the north, east, south, or west orientation of that card
f. hand drawing or placing three dimensional tiles in the shape of the map shown on the new card
g. discarding that used card
h. replacing used card with a new card from the deck
i. alternating these turns within a group of players until every player has had a turn
j. repeating these turns in a cycle as the map grows
k. trading in an unwanted card in the player’s hand for a new card from the deck when the player rolls a 20 with the 20 sided die when orienting the card
l. giving the unwanted card to a rival player
m. progressing through the map, avoiding obstacles and vanquishing enemies
n. linking up the map in the middle so that all players meet
o. battling each other to see which player or team wins
p. ending game when all but one player or team survives.

Knowing that thousands of players have game components that require a game master to make playable, we wanted to create a system for randomly generating dungeons that does that work for you.

Keeping Dungeon Dealer simple was very important to us. One of the best things about tabletop roleplaying is how DIY the culture is. It’s a community built on making and sharing. By keeping this deck simple, we’ve allowed it to be adaptable in countless preexisting systems.
201707.name: Dungeon Dealer

201708.name: Expander
201708.description:
Expander is a fast-paced reaction game that challenges you to take risks.

Collect precious stars by lifting and stretching your colored block.

Shrink it to avoid obstacles. Stay calm and be prepared for mind-boggling twists.

Source: The Developer Website.

201709.name: Mass Effect 2157
201709.description:
From the introduction:

Mass Effect 2157 is a science fiction scenario in three acts set in the Mass Effect media franchise universe. The characters all start the scenario as elite human soldiers. They are sent on a mission to fight against the Turians - a largely unknown enemy and the first intelligence race humankind has met during their exploration of other solar systems.

The rules are an adaptation of the system presented in Lady Blackbird. The game was played in Danish and English at Fastaval 2014, though the rules document was made available only in Danish.

201710.name: Mass Effect 2157: Handouts
201710.description:
User summary:

This document presents extensive handouts including play documents, character sheets, and other game aids all intended for print-and-play use. Note that the document includes numerous full-page, full-color graphics.

The single document includes handouts in both Danish and English.

201711.name: Manden Med Barnevognen
201711.description:
From the introduction:

This game is strongly dependent on mood. Players should attempt a slow, drifting, and eerie tone of pervasive fear. The game master should interject unpleasant changes of pace to life the energy at appropriate narrative points. Play takes place in a dreamlike bubble. The characters' world is nightmarish, skewed, and "wrong" - with no relation to reality. A shared aberration.

The story is about being completely alone with something terrible. The terrible thing that will take everything from you no matter how hard you fight, how careful you are, or how angry and desperate you become.

The game was played at Fastaval 2014 in both Danish and English, though the rules are available only in Danish.

201712.name: Manden Med Barnevognen: Characters
201712.description:
User summary:

To facilitate play in English, the character sheets are available as a separate English-language PDF, intended for print-and-play use. Note the primary game document includes the Danish-language character sheets.

201713.name: Manden Med Barnevognen: Vuggeviser & Ritualer
201713.description:
User summary:

This document presents play aids intended for print-and-play use. The Danish-language version includes nursery rhymes and player rituals; the English-language version includes only the player rituals.

201714.name: Manden Med Barnevognen: Afviklingsnoter
201714.description:
User summary:

This document presents a brief overview of play as it occurred during Fastaval 2014, with a focus on critiquing the game structure. Errata and several suggestions for enhancing play are provided. The principle focus involves increasing the scene structure of the game with an eye toward faster play.

201715.name: Galaxic Echo
201715.description:
From the introduction:

In the game there are two realities, a rich one and a poor one. In the long run, only one of them can exist. The player characters end up deciding which one gets to exist. In a way it's obvious to expect the characters to espouse the equal rights of poor people as human beings but... isn't it better to be rich and healthy than sick and poor? So whose lives are worth more? Or is not choosing an option?

User summary:

The document includes two sections with differing format that may complicate printing. The second section is intended for print-and-play use as game handouts.

Note the game draws from a long-running graphic series titled Valérian and Laureline, though the players need not be familiar with the series.

201716.name: Rocky's Boots
201716.description:
The object of the beginning part of Rocky's Boots is to use a mechanical boot to kick a series of objects (purple or green squares, diamonds, circles, or crosses) off a conveyor belt; each object will score some number of points, possibly negative. To ensure that the boot only kicks the positive objects, the player must connect a series of logic gates to the boot.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky%27s_Boots Rocky's Boots]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

201717.name: Snakebird
201717.description:
What is the longest possible length a bird can be? Obviously a question only all the fruit in the world can answer! But where could all this fruit be hiding? Follow Redbird, Greenbird and Bluebird on a quest for an amount of fruit beyond any birds wildest dreams.

Snakebird is a very simple but deceptively challenging puzzle game about assuming the right shapes for the task at hand, be it pushing, lifting, teleporting or just defying the laws of physics.

Features:

Over fifty challenging levels
Non-linear worldmap
Several different zones with their own themed puzzles
Snake-like birds with narcolepsy
Fruit-powered dynamic length gain system




Source: The Game Website.

201718.name: Braves to Warriors: American Indian Rite of Passage
201718.description:
INTRODUCTION
In America’s “Old West,” the young male braves of many Indian tribes faced difficult trials in order to become warriors. In Braves to Warriors, you and a friend will compete to win five such tests and gain the coveted feather of success in each. At day’s end, only the best brave in the tribe will henceforth be called: “Warrior”!

OBJECT OF THE GAME
Win the most Victory Points (VPs) during the five trials – swimming, tracking, riding, hunting and fighting – and finish the game with a higher score than your opponent.

COMPONENTS
36 cards (7 cards in five suits + one “Big Chief” card)
10 Feather tiles (2 tiles in five suits)

THE CARDS
There are five suits, each reflecting one of the five trials in the game—swimming, tracking, riding, hunting and fighting. Each suit has seven cards valued 1 to 7, which is used during trials. Your goal is to obtain 7 or more of the 13 Success Points (SPs) available during the trial. One SP is scored for each card in the trial suit you take, plus one SP for each value 7 card, during a round of quasi-trick taking.

201719.name: Absolute Drift
201719.description:
DRIFTING
The Art of Sliding Sideways.

In Absolute Drift, you will master the art of drifting. Practice your skills in Free-Roam and compete in drift events such as Driftkhana and Mountain Drifting.

Features:

Drive and customize up to 6 drift cars
3 Game Modes: Driftkhana, Drifting, & Mountain Drifting with 24+ levels
5 Free-Roaming areas, each with unique levels and themes, from airports and docks to a floating metropolis
Online Leaderboards
3+ hours of clean Drum & Bass and Electronic music by C41 and NYTE
Full Controller Support




Source: The Game Website.

201720.description:
Lonely Bears is a 2-4 player casual strategy card game that will have you arming Billy-No-Balloons, Drunk Frank and Scaredy-Cat Matt to the teeth, with Ridable Nukes, Horny Nordic Helmets and all manner of other crazy weapons and armour to defeat your opponents... if you don’t get caught by a game-changing event!
The aim of the game is to kill your opponents bears by equipping them with cards drawn from the deck, balancing an offensive or defensive strategy tailored to the items you pick at random. Attack too soon and you'll be the target, but leave it too late and you'll be the victim!
201720.name: Lonely Bears

201721.name: One Small Fire At A Time
201721.description:
User Summary

13-year-old Janis has "Magic Deficiency Disorder," a madness where one can't use magic in a very magic-oriented world.

201722.name: Four Realms
201722.description:
Four Realms is an action-strategy RPG in an animal filled fantasy world. Level up your Warden, customize your Spell List, and raise an army to stop the Wild Magic.

Source: The Developer Website.

201723.name: Feudalism (2016)
201723.description:
User Summary

Conquer Europe, become an Emperor. Build your family’s dynasty through seven centuries, from 800 A.D. to 1492 A.D.

201724.name: Led It Rain
201724.description:
Motorcycles, guns, monsters and bikini-babes. Led It Rain is first person shooter motorcycle driving racing game. Faster you drive and shoot monsters more score you obtain. Each race track has three laps of horror and adrenaline. Scream!!

Source: The Developer Website.

201725.name: HeartZ: Co-Hope Puzzles
201725.description:
Outsmart traps and solve mysteries in each room and level while getting rid of Dr. Nylus' soldiers and machines! Kick, jump, fart, scare, bite... your way through mischievously designed levels!

Source: The Game Website.

201726.name: Funklift
201726.description:
Wreck your friends in a wild race for logistical glory! Deliver the most items before time runs out in the ultimate forklifting party experience. Reinventing musical party games as we know them. Who will become the champion of the storage?

Source: The Game Website.
