201871.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Blamdown: Udder Fury is a fast-paced twin stick shooter about a cow with a bazooka and a lust for revenge.

It’s all about creating chaos, blowing stuff up and having a fun. Jump on top of buildings, gun down enemy jetpack-troopers and blast away tanks with your trusty bazooka! Battle your way across the American continent to avenge your girlfriend Rosa, who ended up as a Captain Patriot™hamburger for 5.99

201872.name: PowerSlave (DOS)
201872.description:
"PowerSlave, known as Exhumed in Europe and as A.D. 1999: Pharaoh's Revival in Japan, is a first-person shooter developed by Lobotomy Software.

The MS-DOS version of PowerSlave features many differences from the console versions. The MS-DOS version was built on the Build engine, licensed from 3D Realms. The version used is a slightly earlier version of the engine. The light sourcing from the SlaveDriver engine is not used; the Build engine's own light sourcing is used instead.

The HUD interface is different; featuring an ammo counter, lungs (oxygen levels) for swimming and animated mana and blood vessels. Players have usable Mana energy that can cast spells once the spell has been acquired (e.g. collecting a torch allows the player to use energy to illuminate dark areas). Ammo is not universal, instead of blue orbs usable for all weapons, separate ammo is needed. Grenades are used instead of Amun mines. Some sprites are different (e.g. M60 machine gun), sprites are larger and more animated in general. Audible words are used for the player character instead of grunts. Mummies fire a "white skull" attack, or a partly homing red one, that when hit, turns the player into a mummy momentarily, additionally with the most powerful weapon in the game: the Mummy Staff, which can destroy all enemies within range of the player. The player reverts to normal once the weapon is used. Checkpoints are placed throughout the level by indication of golden scarabs and Saving is automatic between levels.

Levels are conducted in a more linear format. Players can replay previously completed levels, but later stages may only be played after completing the level prior. The Manacle of Power fires a lighting cloud above the enemy, rather than firing lighting bolts from the player's hands. Most of the artifacts from the console versions are not present (except the Sobek Mask, which is a spell). The powerups in the Sega Saturn version are included as spells (invisibility, invincibility and double damage). The Ring of Ra weapon is not included. Weapons pause to reload after a certain number of shots are fired. Some enemies have different death animations when killed by fire/grenades; bosses have longer death animations. There are extra lives instead of health extensions. The Amnit enemies are not included; instead there is the giant Ammut miniboss which has ramming and biting attacks. There is additional story text. The transmitter, which was a set of eight key items needed in the console versions to get the better ending, is not in the MS-DOS version per se, but it is seen before the final stage of the game, where the player receives orders to attack the Kilmaat ship. Likewise, the Team Dolls are not in the MS-DOS version."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PowerSlave PowerSlave]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

201873.description:
White Wolf's seventeenth expansion for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle is Heirs to the Blood, which focuses on the bloodlines and infernalists.

Each booster pack contains 11 cards randomly selected from a set of 168 all-new cards consisting of 54 rares, 58 vampires, and 56 commons.

The set also features 4 non-random preconstructed decks: Gargoyle, Kiasyd, Salubri antitribu and Samedi, which contain even more cards and are designed to get beginning players started right away. All the new cards in the preconstructed decks are also found in the boosters, and naturally each preconstructed deck contains reprints of vampires and library cards from earlier sets.


New Stuff

Research Area: Some cards may move cards to a special staging area called the research area. The cards in your research area are face down and out of play; they can be affected only by cards and effects that say so explicitly.
201873.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Heirs to the Blood
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

201874.name: Black Powder, Black Magic (Volume 3)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
201874.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 36 page issue contains:

Fumbles in Black Powder, Black Magic
Kung Fu Monk
Spellburning with Demon Ore
Strange Loot
The Red Duke
It’s Explosive: Black Powder
Varmints! The Malcupine by Daniel Bishop
Varmints! Black Tommy by Noah Stevens
Magic Item: Indigo Signalman’s Lantern by Noah Stevens




In this issue we reveal the patron The Red Duke, which was first glimpsed in Volume 1, and you now have access to fumbles unique to the setting. A new class, the Kung Fu Monk, makes a debut, and now you can spellburn with demon ore! There’s a 30-item random table of strange loot, and the first of a series on explosives, starting with black powder.

This is also the first issue to feature writing from new contributors, Daniel Bishop and Noah Stevens, who gift us the malcupine, Black Tommy, and a new magic item.

201875.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Looking thither they cried in dismay; for black against the glittering stream they beheld a fleet borne up on the wind: dromunds, and ships of great draught with many oars, and with black sails bellying in the breeze." –J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King

The City of Corsairs is the thrilling conclusion to the Dream-chaser cycle of Adventure Packs for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! Its new scenario grants your heroes the opportunity to board the Dream-chaser one last time, set sail for the lands of Umbar, and conclude your business with the Corsairs once and for all. But will you truly be ready for the dangers that await you? Featuring not one, but two new encounter sets, The City of Corsairs challenges you to navigate Umbar's coastal waters and battle past Corsair Ships before you set foot on land to pursue the Númenorean artifact that was stolen from you. Don't expect this task to be easy, though! In their lands, the Corsairs you'll face are deadlier than ever, and the Númenorean artifact grants them a strange and corrupting power.

Fortunately, you don't have to undertake this journey alone. Not only does The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to adventure with up to as many as three of your friends, but it allows you to fill your deck with numerous allies and as many as three heroes. And you find new options for both within The City of Corsairs, including a host of Gondor allies and one of the noblest and most notable names in The Lord of the Rings, Prince Imrahil, who arrives as a Tactics hero, ready for battle.
201875.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The City of Corsairs

201876.name: A Deal with Nadir
201876.description:
From the introduction:

While performing what should be a simple task on behalf of some village elders, the adventurers encounter a powerful Vampire. The Vampire wants to strike a deal with the village elders. Will the Heroes be the brokers of such a deal or find a way to rid the village of the Undead menace?

User summary:

For 4th level characters

201877.description:
Tower defense game themes of Three Kingdoms.

The player become a strategist of Shu. player need to defend player's country from the Wei and Wu army that appear one after another. Protect the base from which the enemy comes to attack, the player has to fight off the enemy if the country will have to decline.
Really, the player defeat all of the army, or will be able to pass through to protect the country?
201877.name: Defense Three Kingdoms

201878.name: A Cauldron Full of Mischief
201878.description:
From publisher blurb:

Allan's roommate, Jeremy, came home from an energy drink launch party last night but this morning he is missing. His car keys and cellphone are still by his bed. Jeremy never leaves without them and this has Allan concerned.

Meanwhile, Barbara was very upset when her granddaughter’s college application was denied. Strangers from out of town can get an education but not a local girl like Brittany. Suddenly, Barbara gives in to the temptation of using a strange recipe she found tucked in between the pages of a romance novel bought at the local bookstore.

What is going on and where is Jeremy?

A Cauldron Full Of Mischief drops you into a quirky mystery that is easily played in a single session or can be the springboard into a great campaign!

Included in the adventure are 5 pregenerated characters as well as two 8 1/2" x 11" size copies of locations from Fabled Environments.

201879.name: Dino Eggs: Rebirth
201879.description:
User Summary

A re-implementaion of the original Apple II/Commodore Dino Eggs game from 1983.

201880.name: Depereo
201880.description:
From the introduction:

- This game is surreal and does not have a plot. There is no chronology. The stranger it gets, the better. Aim for tone and feel, not story and structure.
- Whatever happens it is normal for the characters. They live in this world.
- The major themes are control, passion and destruction.
- There are 4 players but only two physical manifestations of the roles.

User summary:

This game was an English-only scenario for Fastaval 2013. The setting must be created prior to play. Game play combines standard freeform with elements of live-action role-playing. The game assumes an audience of some sort.

201881.name: Theatre of the Oppressed
201881.description:
User summary:

This "Jeepform" game combines traditional free-form play with numerous elements of live-action roleplaying. The game takes place as a sort of meta-game, with the characters acting out parts in a politically energized "forum theater" troupe that is trying to spread certain political viewpoints.

This game was created for an English-only session at Fastaval 2013.

201882.name: Tick Tock Bang Bang
201882.description:
A 30-ton garbage truck screams towards you, plowing through a sea of pedestrians. A swarm of flying drones joins the truck, pinning you down with laser fire. Now’s your chance: you stop, and time slows to a trickle. You grab your gun. You aim. You fire. You weave through the lasers, and time returns to normal. Your bullets speed up and cut your enemies to shreds. As the garbage truck slams into the wall behind you, you turn to the camera for your one-liner: “Time to take out the trash.” You’re going to look great on the big screen.

Tick Tock Bang Bang is a first person shooter for Windows. In it, you play a stunt woman filming a movie based on an the actual events of the 2032 robot attack in Boston, Massachusetts. Slow time and dodge bullets, 100-car pileups, explosions, runaway trucks, and more.

Source: The Game Website.

201883.name: Statik
201883.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE

A game about technology, perception and puzzles.

201884.name: Soccer Director
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition

201884.description:
From the inlay:

In SOCCER DIRECTOR you play a man with a burning ambition - to own all the top clubs in the country. While you realise it's against the rules to own more than one team, you have found a way to buy the shares without anyone realising it is you.

Your objective in the game is to own (i.e. own at least 501 shares in) the top ten clubs at the end of any season, but by the end of season 10 at the latest.

In order to achieve your ambition, you use the First Division clubs to make your money, buying and selling shares as teams succeed and fail. Your capital will increase as share values go up, and you will be paid a weekly dividend by each club you own shares in - IF they make a profit.

You can attempt to influence the success of teams by calling shareholders meetings - the more shares you own, the more influence you have on the outcome of any votes.

201885.name: The Racing Line
201885.description:
In The Racing Line you steer a car token around a course in a succession of straight lines. The length of those lines is determined by your current speed as measured on a special ruler.

You're limited in how much you can change your speed between turns so approaching corners can be very tricky unless you get them just right.
The game also encourages you to pick-up various "Power-up" tokens scattered through the course: Missiles, oil, nitro gas, emp bombs and more!Use these against your enemies, or just bump them off the track in your quest for victory!

201886.name: Bamsers Mod
201886.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Bamsers Mod, a short free-form about a boy Anders who is about to die, and his teddy bears which no longer are able to protect him from his nightmare. The scenario takes place in our world, but in our world where children's fantasies are real. Childhood fantasy creatures and teddy bears are alive, and they are brave warriors who fight with children's nightmares.

At some point we grow up, though, and have more faith in our nightmares, uncertainties, and weaknesses, than in our dreams and our teddy bears.

User summary:

This game was presented for international play at Fastaval 2013. The game document is available only in Danish, though the game handouts are available in Danish (included in the game document) and English (as a separate document).

201887.name: Bamsers Mod: English Handouts
201887.description:
User summary:

Bamsers Mod was presented for international play at Fastaval 2013. The game document is available only in Danish, though the game handouts are available in English is this version of the handout packet.

201888.name: DUCATI - 90th Anniversary
201888.description:
rom the creators of RIDE comes a spin-off entirely dedicated to the legendary Ducati brand - nearly a century of legend wrapped up in one video game!

Source: The Game Website.

201889.name: Sarabande
201889.description:
From the introduction:

In a small café on Montmartre [Paris], a group of people meet day after day at the turn of the 19th century. With their individual rules, conflicts, fears, assumptions and commitments, they play through the same routines again and again. It is as if their lives are frozen in one atonal, unstable harmony seeking redemption, but unable to find peace.

User summary:

Game play assumes some familiarity with the period, politics, and locale of the setting - sufficient background information is provided in the game document.

201890.description:
This is not to be confused with Monopoly Handheld Jackpot which is a handheld battery-operated slot machine.

The twist on the venerable property game is that players get to activate a spinner if they land on a Chance space or roll the Chance icon on the dice. The spinner could reward the player with money or bankrupt the player or send the player to jail.
201890.name: Monopoly Jackpot

201891.name: Motherland
201891.description:
Motherland is a game of suspicion and accusation, paranoia and groupthink. Citizens must stay alert to the Spies among them, while Spies collectively conspire against the Citizens. All in the name of the glorious Motherland.

The dreaded Gulag awaits!

Motherland is a hidden role game where players secretly take on the role of either citizen or spy. Under the watch of the Block Captain, each round takes place in three phases: Gossip (players discuss who should be sent to the Gulag), Troika (a team of three players votes on who to send to the Gulag), and Darkness (Spies that have not already been sent to the Gulag secretly notify the Block Captain of an additional player that gets sent to the Gulag by force in the night). Gameplay continues repeating rounds until only two players remain outside of the Gulag. If only citizens remain, the citizens win the game. If even one spy remains free, the spies win.

201892.name: Sewer Goblins
201892.description:
From the introduction:

During Drakonheim’s golden age, the city planners designed an extensive sewer system beneath the city. The wealthier homes connected directly to these sewers, while the poorer folk used public latrines. In their time, the sewers were marvels of engineering, but as the empire declined they fell into disrepair.

A few hundred years ago a small band of goblins entered one of the drainage pipes and found the sewers to be a perfect home. They have been thriving and multiplying ever since, and now thousands of goblins live beneath the streets of Drakonheim.

Some goblins emerge from the sewers to explore the world beyond. The Savage Worlds Drakonheim Companion presents them as a new playable race with new Racial Edges. Goblins also feature prominently in the first chapter of the Heroes of Drakonheim adventure. The heroes trudge through goblin-filled sewers where they meet the (potential) helpful Gozy the Quiet, and the final encounter pits the heroes and a murderous corpse-selling goblin name Korth Fat Rat.

201893.name: Necromancy
201893.description:
From the introduction:

The rise of the Gray Society, a cabal of necromancers, is a major theme in Drakonheim.

User summary:

Presents new hindrances, edges, and additional rules to support necromancers, necromancy, and the undead.

201894.name: Tentacles? Really?!
201894.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ooothulukay has opened a portal to the Lands of Igpay through which he is capturing and enslaving the hapless elves of that land. They are forced to serve as his undead minions, and evil is spreading throughout Igpay. The elves are disappearing, one-by-one, and soon there may be none left, even at the taverns. You might have to get up from your bar stool to get your own flagon of ale.

Intolerable. This Oothulukay guy owes you a cold one. Besides, there might be loot.

Let's just hope you don't become the cold one.

Tentacles? Really?! is a mid-level, somewhat humorous fantasy adventure for parties of three or more with moderate equipment (some magical items). It is written using a generic statistic system that makes it readily convertible to almost any role-playing system.

201895.name: Quick Draw McGraw
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
201895.description:
From the inlay:

In the Wild West it's a hard life being a train driver. Trying to get your passengers and cargo safely to their destination is almost impossible. It's guaranteed somewhere along the journey Bandits and Indians will attack the train and steal everything they can.

The train needs a guard - Someone who's courageous, cunning, smart and most of all good with a gun. Who better to take on this role than Quick Draw McGraw, the fastest Hoof in the West.

You play the part of Sheriff McGraw who has four trains in all to protect, rid each one of enemies and dispose of the head Honcho perched smugly at the front of the train.

At various places Quick Draw has to enter a carriage and clear out the enemy inside.

User Summary

Quick Draw McGraw was a character in a series of Hanna-Barbera cartoons that originally ran from 1959 to 1962.

In Kologeon you face off against a menegrie of otherwordly beasts and warriors. Set in a mystical world of demons, spirits, and ancient beings.

201897.name: Summer Lovin'
201897.description:
Authors' blurb:

Three girls, three guys and the stories about who did what and with who during a big. summer music festival. We will get the story as told by the girls, as told by the guys and then finally played out as it really happened. It’s summer lovin’ and tell me more.

This scenario is not about finding your perfect partner, having amazing sex right away, and living happily ever after. It is a scenario about the uncomfortable hook up in the tent, the grass in the ass, and the poor communication which leads to it all being awkward. But also about the nice feeling of making out, the thrill, the hope of something more, the fun and the laughter.

What really happened during the festival? How did the dead gorgeous guy you hooked up with turn out to be your crappiest lay ever? Or how did you end up in the caravan with the girl you’ve wanted for several years, even though you shouldn’t have been there in the first place? At least according to your partner.

Sex is a the main theme of this scenario, but you will not get physical with the other players above holding hands. Then the scene will be told thought storytelling down to every nitty, gritty detail, both physically and emotionally.

Just tell me more!

201898.name: Vigilante: Justified Revenge?
201898.description:
Author's summary:

Vigilante: Justified Revenge? Is a game of vigilantism, inspired by American movies like "Death Wish" or "Ms. 45 ". The goal is to put the vigilante genre into a framework that players use to define what kind of vigilante story they want to create, and then unfold in gory detail the morally questionable actions.

The game does not use a game master, instead it is structured via a game board, different maps and instructions to each player. The game is written in English and suggests that the story takes place in an American environment.

User summary:

The game was created a the Fastaval 2012 "international" session. The game is distributed as a ZIP archive including these files:

201899.description: Ashes: The Roaring Rose, which features new Phoenixborn Leo Sunshadow, is a full, ready-to-play Ashes expansion deck including three conjurations. Leo requires ten Charms (pink) dice to play, which are included in the Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.

201900.description: Ashes: The Duchess of Deception, which features new Phoenixborn Victoria Glassfire, is a full, ready-to-play Ashes expansion deck including two conjurations. Victoria requires ten Illusion (purple) dice to play, which are included in the Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn base set.

201901.name: LOGS
201901.description:
User summary
ログズ (LOGS) is an abstract game for two players. Each turn, you may place your pin on a 9x9 grid of intersections, or make a special move using your large pin. You can play two types of game with it. The game was originally published in 2015, then revised and re-issued in 2016 with the "bloom" rules also added.

(1)LOGS connect
The goal is to build a complete route on the board from your end to your opponent's end by only your own pins. You may place your pin adjacent to any of your existing pin, or remove your opponent's pin by placing your large pin if adjacent to any of your existing pins.

(2)LOGS bloom
You score victory points by orthogonally surrounding an intersection with your pins, then placing your large pin on that intersection. You may place your pin on any vacant intersection.

Publisher's summary
"LOGS"はアブストラクトゲームで、2つのゲームが遊べます。
1つは"LOGS connect"。プレイヤーはお互いの対辺を先に繋げることを目指します。大きなコマと相手の普通のコマを取りかえることができるルールが特徴です。
もう一つは"LOGS bloom"。陣取りした場所に、多くの点数を得ることが目的です。普通のコマで囲まれた場所の中心に大きなコマを置けば得点になります。

A standard solitaire game in which you uncover and eliminate special golden cards to advance. Money is paid for matches that can be cashed in for special powers, like wild joker cards, reshuffling, or mulligans.

201911.description:
User Summary

Similar to the 12 Labours of Hercules series, you are tasked to remove wood and stones, repair holes and bridges, and harvest food and wood. You awake other characters or powers to complete aims and progress. There are time limits.

201912.name: King & Parliament
201912.description:
The conflict between King Charles I and Parliament had come to an irreparable breach by the time the King raised his royal standard at Nottingham. There was now war between the King and his Parliament and the country was divided in its loyalties. The Royalists, who favor the King’s cause, begin the war with many excellent troops and an advantage in cavalry troops, but have initial limited financial support from mostly towns and castles. Parliament starts with a somewhat reliable force in the London Trained Bands and a more solid financial backing from most of the kingdom’s cities, but initial cavalry and leaders do not inspire confidence. Of course, the fortunes of war can change these circumstances over time.


Two Player game refighting what is often referred to as the First English Civil War. This Renaissance conflict is often identified in the “Pike and Shot” category, since musketeers fought around blocks of pike men for protection from cavalry.
Troop Types are represented with abstract counters. Infantry counters denote up to 1500 men and cavalry units represent up to 1000 men. There are units of dragoons and artillery trains as well. Special and elite units are also represented, such as the Northern Horse, Cornish Infantry, Lifeguards, and Hasselrigg’s Lobsters. Both sides can also press Levies into service when necessary.
Game Boards display a map of England and most of Scotland. It is hex based with terrain within each and many prominent towns, cities, manor houses and castles are portrayed. Some of these locations have high fortification ratings and some do not. Necessary playing tables are located on the board for ease of play and necessary reference charts are provided to assist the players.
Noteworthy Commanders are represented in the game, with holding boxes for leaders of larger armies.
Multiple Scenarios to play depending on when players want to begin and how long they want to play.


Game Features


Leader Driven - Play is divided into turns, but players move alternately, sometimes one going before the other a few times depending on circumstances. Leaders are the core to the game system with all actions being mostly conducted by them. Leaders have ability ratings for strategy and battle. Some also have special characteristics peculiar to them such as Impetuous, Financial Resources, Cavalry Commander, etc.
Multiple Events Combination - These continuously have an effect on the game. This is provided by a combination of the turn chart, a random events table, and event counters. Event counters are played immediately on locations, leaders, or units and at times are deployed by the choice of a player.
Strategy Counters - These can be rolled for by leaders, and the larger their rating the better. This provides some uncertainty as well as advantages and disadvantages as appropriate to each case. Strategy counters can be played immediately or held for the duration of the turn for opportune moments.
Variable Combat System - Each side has a respective Battle Deck to add more panache to the Combat Result Table (CRT). The CRT gauges results based upon the size of the battle, so it is not one size fits all.
Scotland Shown - Many games on the English Civil War focus solely England and Wales. The necessary parts of Scotland are shown here to include the effects of Montrose’s campaign on the war.
Attractive Coin Counters - Provided to help track paying for the cost of war.

201913.name: The Daring & the Doomed: The Elder Dooms
201913.description: Prepare yourself for the mind-bending madness of The Elder Dooms! This Cthulhu/Zombie inspired expansion adds more tentacles and craziness to your game with 74 more cards!

201914.name: IKEA
201914.description:
Author's description:

IKEA. We've all been there and now you relive your experiences in the game. "The Church of Retail" or "Saturday Hell"? A favorite destination for all life's great turning points - leaving home, moving, bringing home a new baby, or when divorce or death suddenly leaves you stranded. Maybe IKEA isn't as soulless as it looks in the catalog...

IKEA is a free-form small comedy where characters experience a day of "The Church of Retail" or "Saturday Hell", depending on their temperament. The game is structured in scenes that bring out secret inner thoughts while the characters ostensibly are only trying to find that special off-white furniture set that will complete the room.

And as with most things from IKEA, with this scenario some assembly is required.

User summary:

This game was written for Fastaval 2011 "international" play. The game document is available only in Danish, though the "Errands" (handouts) are available in Danish- and English-language versions. With illustrations from the IKEA catalog.

201915.description:
User summary:

IKEA was written for Fastaval 2011 "international" play. While the core game document is available only in Danish, these "Errands" (handouts) are available in Danish- and English-language versions.

201916.name: Femten Mand
201916.description:
User summary:

This (mostly) Danish-language game uses a series of cards that are dealt in secret to each character. The cards indicate other characters. The card holder gains one point for each of the indicated characters that survives the voyage home (thus forming secretive alliances). The player(s) with the most points at the end of the game are declared the winners of the treasure. Combat involves playing a variable number of combat cards... and hoping for the best. Players can be eliminated if their character is killed during play. Yo ho, yo ho, and a bottle of rum!

The game was created for "international" play at Fastaval 2011. The main game documents are in Danish, but a "quick start" style rules summary and the handouts also are available in English. The game is distributed as a ZIP archive that includes these files:

201917.description:
Mech Command RTS is a real time strategy board game where all players pilot mechs, fire weapons, activate equipment and direct support troops simultaneously.

The first board game of its kind, Mech Command RTS has been designed to be fast to setup, fast to teach and fast to play. Featuring unique components like LED pointers built into each miniature's base to provide instantaneous line of sight as well as physical buildings to provide cover and a rooftop level.

Between the 20 minute missions, players spend their hard-earned rewards on upgrading their mechs and equipment. Construct your mech according to your play-style and team role. Over the course of the campaign, teams will strive to accomplish objectives for their faction to reclaim the earth.
201917.name: Mech Command RTS

Then your little munchkins (or you!) can color the 26 all-new illustrations by Munchkin fan-favorite John Kovalic.

The book also includes ten new Munchkin cards, so you can surprise your friends more easily than jumping out of a closet and shouting, "Abcdef!" From now on, ABC stands for Attack, Backstab, and Color!

At the beginning of play the players will receive their respective characters—the investigators. That is all they need, initially. When the investigators split up after the first scene each player also receives a booklet with the witnesses and suspects that he or she is going to play. 201920.description:
In Pocket Madness, you'll meet nice people like Shub-Niggurath, visit lovely places like Innsmouth, and cross the path of friendly creatures such as the Shoggoths.

Pocket Madness is a fast-paced card game inspired by the writings of H.P. Lovecraft, known worldwide for his short story "The Call of Cthulhu". In the game, you evoke the powers of the Ancient Ones to drive your fellow cultists mad while securing your path to victory. To play, you first deal each player two cards from a deck that contains cards numbered 6-12, then you count out 17 face-down cards, flip the remainder face up, shuffle the deck, then lay it out in a row so that all players can see the cards.

On a turn, you either take 1-3 cards, open a portal, or open an investigation. When you take card, you pick up the first 1-3 cards in the row, then add them to your hand. To open a portal, you lay down three or more cards of the same type, then take the portal matching the number on those cards. Each portal has a different power, and you can use any one portal power on your turn. If someone else claims a portal that you own, too bad! You just lost the portal! To open an investigation, discard cards numbered 6-12, after which every other player gains as many madness tokens as the number of investigations this round.

A round ends when one player runs out of cards or the card row runs out. In the latter case, everyone takes one final turn, then all players gain madness tokens equal to the number of different types of cards in their hand. If a player empties their hand, that player loses half of their madness tokens while everyone else gains one.

The game ends the round that a player has collected ten or more madness tokens.
201920.name: Pocket Madness

201921.description:
A world of peace has been torn asunder by the opening of a vile portal from the goblin kingdom. Nasty goblins pour into the peaceful groves and villages of the elf world, setting the realm ablaze. Now you, the heroes, must quest in order to right this wrong. There are two paths to victory: closing the portal or slaying all the goblins. Which one will you choose? Either way, your quests will be aided by the help of the surviving mushroom folk — and by the epic items that have been lost in the realm's deep dungeons. The world is ending quickly, so you must act fast to save it, but you also need to know when your luck will run out...

In Tiny Epic Quest, players embark on a sandbox adventure reminiscent of classic video games. Each player controls a band of three elf heroes questing to save the world and the sacred mushroom folk from the intruding goblins.

Each round is broken into two phases: day and night. During the day, players travel far and wide, visiting villages to acquire quests, monuments to learn powerful spells, mushroom groves to seek guidance, and treacherous locations in search of artifacts! Acquiring artifacts empower the heroes with unique abilities; this may improve a heroes' movement or combat, or their ability to learn spells or mitigate harmful dice rolls.

Heroes must travel by foot, by horse, by raft, by boat and by gryphon to get to everywhere they need to go to satisfy their quests — or to position themselves for what night brings. As each type of movement is different, and limited, players need to take careful consideration when traveling, and how they travel, if they wish to accomplish all of their goals.

During the night, players must face the challenge of their quests, and decisions, by rolling dice, hoping for fortune, and knowing when to quit. Will you press on? Or is it time to save your progress and rest? Tomorrow is another day.

The game ends once the portal is closed or all the goblins have been eradicated. The player who has acquired the most victory points by slaying goblins, learning spells, and completing quests is crowned the winner!

A broom, rotating slippers, meatloaf explosives and aggressive grannies!
All this is Angry Granny!!!
A game up to six players where you have to drive your grandmother in a fight full of explosives and grandchildren of Alzheimer attacks with purpose of winning the coveted old-age pension!!

Angry Granny is an easy game to learn but more and more challenging as they play! You have to choose very carefully the grandmother to attack because it might hide some surprises ...
in short, this is a game in order to put an end to even the most solid friendships!.
Grandmothers of Angry Granny will change forever!!
There are no more grandmothers of a time!

The goal of the game is to defeat other players reducing their grandmas' score to zero! The last player who survives with his grandma is the winner.

Supplying phase: The turn player take a card from the fighting deck. He reveals it to everyone and then he holds it among his cards.

Main phase: The turn player can play cards of his hand respecting a sequenze of colors in the use of the cards (first yellow, then red and finally purple cards).
